title: Twist Grip Position Sensor - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
From VIN AG1638 the routing of the handle bar harnesses has changed.
When installing the twist grip position sensor on models built before AG1638, route the handlebar harnesses as described in the procedure below.
For models built before AG1638, the routing for the left hand must also be changed to the new routing as described in handlebar installation (see
Slide the twist grip position sensor onto the handlebar in the orientation noted for removal.
Route the cable to the rear of the brake master cylinder union.
Secure the right hand switch housing and twist grip cables to each other with a cable tie next to the brake master cylinder union, as shown below.
Secure the right hand switch housing and twist grip cables to the handle with the rubber band at the beginning of the first bend, as shown below.

body.name: Secure harnesses RH switch housing clcn

body.body: Position the twist grip cable through the front subframe as noted for removal.
Connect the twist grip position sensor electrical connector to the main harness.
Secure the electrical connector to the front subframe
Twist grip position sensor electrical connector (main harness side)
Twist grip position sensor electrical connector tab
Secure the twist grip cable to switch housing cables with the rubber band. Make sure the twist grip cable is positioned in front of the switch housing cables.
Align the rubber band to the electric steering lock cover split line, as shown in the illustration below.

body.name: Secure TPS harness to switch housing harnesses clcm

body.body: Check the routing of the harnesses on the left hand side of the handlebar. If required, reroute the harnesses as described in handlebar installation (see

Handlebars - Installation
Slide the twist grip position sensor onto the handlebar in the orientation noted for removal.
Route the cable to the rear of the brake master cylinder union.
Secure the right hand switch housing and twist grip cables to each other with a cable tie next to the brake master cylinder union, as shown below.
Secure the right hand switch housing and twist grip cables to the handle with the rubber band at the beginning of the first bend, as shown below.
Switch housing cables
Twist grip position sensor cable
Cable tie
Rubber strap
Position the twist grip cable through the front subframe as noted for removal.
Connect the twist grip position sensor electrical connector to the main harness.
Secure the electrical connector to the front subframe
Twist grip position sensor electrical connector (main harness side)
Twist grip position sensor electrical connector tab
Headlight electrical connector
Secure the twist grip cable to switch housing cables with the rubber band. Make sure the twist grip cable is positioned in front of the switch housing cables.
Align the rubber band to the electric steering lock cover split line, as shown in the illustration below.
Twist grip position sensor harness
Switch housing harnesses
Rubber band
Steering lock cover split line
